Angular Momentum

The variation of the angular momentum vector can indicate if a galaxy is experiencing perturbations such as infall or merger events. This might be a useful diagnostic if you wish to study the galaxy’s stellar or gas dynamics.

check_angmom_reliability.angmom(xyz, vxyz, m, frac)

Calculates the angular momentum from the mass enclosed within the specified mass fraction frac.

Parameters

  • xyz – 3xN array with cartesian particle positions

  • vxyz – 3xN array with cartesian particle velocities

  • m – 1xN array with particle masses

  • frac – mass fraction within which to calculate the angular momentum.

Returns

Lhat

check_angmom_reliability.angular_momentum_variation(max_frac=0.3, shells=5)

Calculates the root mean square variation of the angular momentum from the center up to a specified enclosed mass. The variation serves as a test whether the galaxy is undergoing perturbations.

Parameters

  • max_frac – mass fraction corresponding to the enclosed mass up to which the angular momentum variation is calculated. Default is 0.3.

  • shells – number of shells for which to calculate the angular momentum. Default is 5.

Returns

Lhat variation for each galaxy in the sample
